attributes.action: Call a General Election as soon as the new Conservative Party Leader is declared
attributes.additional_details:
A previous petition calling for 'a General Election if Theresa May resigned' - https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/252449 - received just over 46k signatures and a formal response was issued by the Government on June 13th 2019.

We now call upon all current Members of Parliament to take the measures open to them under the Fixed-term Parliaments Act 2011, namely to present a motion “That this House has no confidence in Her Majesty’s Government” and thus allow for an early General Election.
attributes.background:
We do not believe the new Prime Minister would dare table the required motion '“That there shall be an early parliamentary general election”'; we call on all other current Members of Parliament to do so.

Anything less would be to blatantly deny the public our democratic rights.
